I’m always looking for fun and simple crafts to decorate my home. Having a love for all things burlap, I decided that I wanted to make a burlap wreath for my front door. This wreath took no longer than 20 minutes and I love how it turned out! Not only does it look great, but the whole project ended up … Continue reading → The post DIY Burlap Wreath appeared first on A Mom's Take.

Just two short years ago, my husband and I scraped by from month to month barely making ends meet and definitely living paycheck to paycheck. We made it a goal and work extremely hard to pay off our debt from student loans and a car loan and start building up our savings. The first step we took was building up … Continue reading → The post Build a $1000 Emergency Fund in (less than) a year! appeared first on A Mom's Take.

There’s nothing like waiting until the last minute. If you were unexpectedly invited to a party or just looking for a inexpensive desert the Angel Food Poke cake is the way to go! It gives the dish a little extra something special. All you will need to make a Strawberry Angel Food Poke Cake is: Store bought angel food cake … Continue reading → The post Strawberry Angel Food Poke Cake Recipe appeared first on A Mom's Take.

Some may call me a breakfast food fanatic. I enjoy devouring pancakes and waffles any time of the day. In fact, just today, I had pancakes for lunch. However, these pancakes were not just your typical pancakes. These pancakes were chocolate chip pancakes bathed in the world’s best homemade buttermilk syrup. Friends of the family introduced this recipe into my … Continue reading → The post World’s Best Homemade Buttermilk Syrup Recipe appeared first on A Mom's Take.
